Key Match Events: Malik Monk scored a game-high 31 points
Jaylen Wells led the way for Memphis with 30 points
The Kings came out and played with a pace and energy that I hadn’t seen from this team since that first Beam Team year
Keon Ellis picked up three quick fouls in the first two minutes

De'Aaron Fox got stripped on one end of the floor with the Kings up 109-108, he made an aggressive attempt to stop Scottie Pippen Jr. from scoring at the rim but missed the ball and hit Pippen’s head instead, resulting in a Flagrant 1
DeMar DeRozan hit a game-winning three-pointer at the buzzer
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Christie mentioned that he wanted the Kings to shoot at least 40 threes a game
De'Aaron Fox expressed frustration with the officials in the second half after drawing contact multiple times on drives and not getting to the line
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was fast and frenetic from the start
The Kings were without Keegan Murray once again and so opted for a smaller but quicker lineup with Keon Ellis starting once again against a bigger, more physical Grizzlies team
Trey Lyles came in and hit three triples of his own in the first quarter
Devin Carter also made his debut in the first quarter, and showcased his defensive intensity, a knack for rebounding the ball, and a nice ability to push the fastbreak himself
The Kings ended a 102-minute scoring drought with a Trey Lyles cherry pick dunk at the end of the quarter
The Kings maintained a 102-100 lead heading into the final frame, but the momentum and style of play was decidedly favoring Memphis at this point
DeMar DeRozan made two clutch free throws to seal the win in overtime
Vince Carter announced his retirement after the game
